prompt: Why am I not receiving any notifications in XWiki.
expected_answer: Make sure that notifications are enabled. You can enable them by setting the `notifications.enabled` setting in `xwiki.properties` to `true`. Further, ensure that you're subscribed to the pages or users you want to receive notifications for. You can watch a page, a page and its children, or an entire wiki. To watch a location, all you need is to go to that place, and then click on the "alert" menu (represented by a bell) and enable the desired notifications. To follow a user, if you go to the profile of an user, using the User Index for example, you can see decide to watching a user. It means you will receive all notifications about events triggered by this user. In your user profile, if you go to the "network" tab, you can see the list of users you are watching and the events that have been performed by them.

sources.content:
[![notif3.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notif3.png?rev=1.5)](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notif3.png?rev=1.5)

The "Clear All" link will remove all notifications that were sent till now.

When no notification is available, you will see the following:

[![notif5.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notif5.png?rev=1.4)](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notif5.png?rev=1.4)

By default, you won't receive notifications for actions done by yourself. This can be changed by switching off the Own event filter.

## Group of notifications with details

Similar notifications are grouped together in order to avoid a batch of identical content. Only one notification is displayed, and it is possible to see the details of all activities in the "Details" section (if any).

![CompositeNotification.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/CompositeNotification.png?rev=1.4)  
![CompositeNotification2.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/CompositeNotification2.png?rev=1.4)

XWiki 15.5+ We started to expose different ways of grouping notifications. All the details can be found on the dedicated page about [Notification Grouping Strategies](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/GroupingStrategies).

# Dependencies

Dependencies for this extension (org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-notifications-ui 16.3.1):

* org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-notifications-preferences-default 16.3.1
* [org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-notifications-macro-ui](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Macro/) 16.3.1
* org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-notifications-script 16.3.1
* org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-notifications-filters-default 16.3.1
* org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-notifications-notifiers-default 16.3.1
* org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-notifications-filters-watch 16.3.1
* org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-notifications-rest 16.3.1
* org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-eventstream-store-solr 16.3.1
* org.webjars:bootstrap-switch 3.3.4
* [org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-rendering-macro-velocity](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Velocity%20Macro) 16.3.1
* org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-icon-script 16.3.1
* [org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-user-profile-ui](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/User%20Module/User%20Profile%20Application/) 16.3.1
* [org.xwiki.rendering:xwiki-rendering-macro-html](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/HTML%20Macro) 16.3.1
* [org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-alerts-ui](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Alerts%20Application/) 16.3.1
* [org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-date](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Date%20Script%20Service/) 16.3.1
* [org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-rendering-macro-code](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Code%20Macro/) 16.3.1
* [org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-livedata-macro](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Live%20Data%20Macro/) 16.3.1
* org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-livedata-livetable 16.3.1
* org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-notifications-webjar 16.3.1

There are several ways you can be notified in XWiki:

* [Notifications Application](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Notifications#HNotificationsApplication)
* [Share Page by mail](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Notifications#HSharePagebymail)
* [RSS Feeds](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Notifications#HRSSFeeds)
* [Mentions](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Notifications#HMentions)
* [What's New](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Notifications#HWhat27sNew)

# Notifications Application

XWiki 9.3+ You can receive [notifications](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/) in the top bar, under the Alert entry (represented by a bell).

[![notif2.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notif2.png?width=650&rev=1.5)](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notif2.png?rev=1.5)



# Share Page by mail

The [Share Page Application](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Share%20Page%20Application) allows sending a page by mail to someone (another user of the wiki or any email address).

![sharePageDialog.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Share%20Page%20Application/sharePageDialog.png?rev=1.1)

# RSS Feeds

You can also get notification from activity taking place on an XWiki instance [using RSS feeds](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/RSS).

# Mentions

XWiki 12.5+ You can get notified when somebody mentions you in pages, comments, or fields supporting xwiki syntax, see [Mentions Application](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Mentions%20Application/).

#-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  
  
#-# [Since 9.4RC1]  
#-# Indicates if the notification module should be enabled on the platform.  
#-#  
#-# The default is :  
# notifications.enabled = true## Enable and disable the email feature

The administrator can disable the "email" notifications by editing the configuration variable "notifications.emails.enabled" in xwiki.properties and restarting the server. 

#-# [Since 9.5C1]  
#-# Indicates if the notifications module can send emails.  
#-#  
#-# The default is :  
# notifications.emails.enabled = trueIn case you have scalability issues with the feature, please contact us to describe your problem. In any case, disabling the notification emails could help.

## Customize live email notifications grace time

The wiki users can receive live email notifications when an event is triggered in the wiki. In order to reduce the load on the server and on your MTA, you can define a live notification grace time in xwiki.properties with the variable notifications.emails.live.graceTime. The server should be restarted for the changes to take effect.

#-# [Since 9.6RC1]  
#-# Indicate the grace time used when sending live email notifications.  
#-# When an event is triggered in the wiki (for example, a document update), the platform will wait X minutes  
#-# before sending live notifications emails. During this time, if events of the same kind are recieved, they will  
#-# be grouped in the same email.  
#-#  
#-# The grace time define the period (in minutes) for which the platform should wait before sending a notification  
#-# mail after an event.  
#-#  
#-# The default is :

# What's New

XWiki 15.1+ The [What's New Application](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/WhatsNewUI/) allows you to get notified about news regarding XWiki.
